hive_text_custom.text: : So what are three foods that you                absolutely have to have that you can't live without?
arepa. It's like my daily breakfast in Venezuela.

: Arepa is made of corn flour, and it looks
                                like a hamburger. So you put anything you want inside
                                and it's very tasty. And I would say like 95 percent of
                                Venezuelans eat arepas every day. Well, it's kind of like a high-carb diet in my country.
                                So I need rice also for lunch, and bread. Bread is
                                another thing. In the afternoon, a piece of bread, sweet
                                bread with coffee is kind of like
: So lots and lots of carbs in your diet.

: Yes. What about you? What about in
                                England?

: Well, English breakfast is not the
                                healthiest of breakfast. It's like a big plate with
                                fried eggs, fried sausages, hash browns, like hash
                                potatoes, beans, just everything fried and everything
                                delicious. And I would say that I can't live without that, but if I ate it every day, then I would probably
                                not be able to leave my house because I would be so, so
                                fat. But it's definitely a food that is in my top foods

. That's probably my favorite. But recently, I've been eating lots of tofu. It's
                                breakfast.

: Yeah. So a little bit of tofu, a little
                                bit of soy sauce just for breakfast, which is just –
                                it's a bit of a boring breakfast. But it's really
                                healthy, I guess. So I've been eating that a lot every
                                day. So I probably can't live without that recently. And also, pizza. Pizza.

: Pizza. I think everyone can't live
                                without pizza.

: Pizza is the best. Pizza is definitely a
                                food that I can't live without.

: Yeah, I try to have pizza probably once a
                                week, I would say. Yeah.
: Cheese and bacon. Oh it sounds good.
: Just cheese and bacon or anything else?

: No, no. I'm going for anything actually
                                but I will always need to have cheese and bacon on my
                                pizza.
: Pizza is not pizza without cheese.

: So what else do you have? So you said
                                tofu, pizza, what other food can you live without?

: Well, my grandma is part Italian. So we
                                have lots of like pasta and lasagna in our family.  So I try and eat – well, I try not to eat
                                a lot of pasta because I'll get really fat. But pasta is
                                definitely something that I can't live without. So good.
: Yeah. Italian food is so good.
: Yeah. And again, lots of cheese.

: Yeah. We also do a lot of lasagna but,
                                well, we call it pasticho.

: It's a different name but it's the same
                                lasagna. And it's also very

: So good. So what would you say is your
                                comfort food?

: My comfort food – that would be arepa,
                                again. Yeah, definitely.

: You said you're going to have lots of
                                like fillings in that.

: Yes. So my favorite would be black beans
                                with cheese inside. It sounds a little bit like a mix up
                                of things but it's really, really tasty. We do eat a lot
                                of black beans every day in Venezuela. It's very common.
                                What about you?
: My comfort food, I can't eat it

as much
                                as I would like

to these days but it's probably my mom's
                                spaghetti Bolognese. So good. It's so good, like lots of
                                pasta, lots of tomato, lots of herbs, lots of cheese.

: It's amazing. I would like live with my
                                parents if it meant I could have spaghetti Bolognese
                                every day. So good. So tasty. I think it's the best

answers: a) She eats it every day.
b) It is not that healthy
c) It is easy to cook.
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 2) What does she say about the English breakfast?
3) Lately, Katie has been eating lots of _____.

hive_text_custom.text: When we can't live without something, we like it very much. Not having it would make us sad. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I can't live without music.
 I could never live without coffee.

hive_text_custom.text: Sweet bread with coffee is kind of like                                    mandatory.
When something is mandatory, that means you have to do it. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The test is mandatory.
 It is mandatory that students wear a uniform.

hive_text_custom.text: That is in my top foods
means something has always been a favorite. Here, top means favorite. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Star Wars is my favorite movie of all time.
 He is my top favorite teacher of all time.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, tasty means some food tastes good, or is delicious. We often use tasty to describe delicious foods that are salty or creamy. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: This pie is so tasty.This soup is very tasty.

hive_text_custom.text: What would you say is your comfort food?
A comfort food is a food that gives people comfort or happiness when they eat it. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Pizza is my comfort food.
 My mom's home cooking is  comfort food for me.

hive_text_custom.text: I can't eat it as much as I'd like.
We use the phrase 'not ...as much as I'd like' to show we really like something, or should do something, but cannot do it for various reasons. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I don't get home as much as I'd like.
 I love golf, but don't play as much as I'd like.
